channel.title: Lightbox on andrew huang
channel.description: Recent content in Lightbox on andrew huang

item.title: soph week 1/20 - 1/24
item.description:
slightly shorter week due to mlk day, so i focused more on double checking everything rather than starting something new.

box design (completed?)

i first created the lid for my box, which utilizes friction-fit, eliminating the need to use screws to keep the aesthetics clean.

additionally, i designed a separate compartment to house my neopixel. i previously had the component connected with my lid, but that would lead to overhang when printing. by creating it as a new component, i will have to print them separately, and combine them together.

item.title: soph week 1/13 - 1/17
item.description:
finally figured out how all the bugs work, and fixed them.

another week of the lightbox project, where i spent monday finalizing my code, before working purely on my box design.

box design

i started this week by restarting my entire box, as i previously didn’t have my box cenetered around the origin, and i was building it on the wrong axis. additionally, the dimensions were all messed up, as i was using a wrong scale. upon fixing all my mistakes, i started adding in all of the different type of connection ports on the mac mini. these ports won’t have any functionality besides one, which will be used for powering the lightbox.

item.title: soph week 1/2 - 1/10
item.description:
new years, same bugs.

due to the new years, i decided to just incorperate the 2 days we had on the 2nd, and the 3rd to this post.

i started this week by focusing on the pcb design for my lightbox, and got guidance from my friend miles on how to create the pcb.

2d model of my pcb

shown above is the 2d model of my pcb, where i tried to make it as compact as possible, in the effort to create as small of a board as possible. i may redesign the board to use a type-c connector for power to better fit my design

item.title: soph week 12/16 - 12/20
item.description:
this week was all about lightbox project, where i had lots of issues.

generally with the lightbox, you use an atmega328p, but i decided to create as small of a lightbox as possible, and ended up using an attiny84

orignally, i was planning to use an attiny25, as the shop doesn’t have an attiny85’s, but the problem is that despite using lightweight libraries to allow the attiny25 to run the code, it just cannot handle the neopixel, and leads to plenty of errors.
